definition: a state powerful enough to influence events throughout the world, supply the force or power for the functioning of
details:
noun
- a state powerful enough to influence events throughout the world
= synonyms: world power, major power, great power, superpower
- a very wealthy or powerful businessman
= synonyms: king
- one possessing or exercising power or influence or authority
= example: one possessing or exercising power or influence or authority
= synonyms: force
- (physics) the rate of doing work
- (of a government or government official) holding an office means being in power
= synonyms: office
- physical strength
= synonyms: might
- possession of controlling influence
= example: possession of controlling influence
= synonyms: powerfulness
- possession of the qualities, especially mental qualities, required to do something or get something done
= example: possession of the qualities, especially mental qualities, required to do something or get something done
= synonyms: ability
- a mathematical notation indicating the number of times a quantity is multiplied by itself
= synonyms: index, exponent
verb
- supply the force or power for the functioning of
= example: supply the force or power for the functioning of
